content: <ce:para view="all">The [Pb(pcp)]complex has been synthesized by reacting equimolar amounts of H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>pcp and Pb(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> in boiling water. Standing of the solution in a closed flask for a day, at 353 K, afforded colorless needle-shaped crystals suitable for an X-ray study. The compound is insoluble in water and in both polar and apolar organic solvents. (Yield, 50 mg, 63%. <ce:italic>Anal.</ce:italic> Calcd. for C<ce:inf loc="post">13</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">12</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>P<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>Pb: C, 31.14; H, 2.41%. <ce:italic>Found</ce:italic>: C, 31.27; H, 2.45%.)</ce:para>
clean_text: The [Pb(pcp)]complex has been synthesized by reacting equimolar amounts of H2pcp and Pb(NO3)2 in boiling water. Standing of the solution in a closed flask for a day, at 353 K, afforded colorless needle-shaped crystals suitable for an X-ray study. The compound is insoluble in water and in both polar and apolar organic solvents. (Yield, 50 mg, 63%. Anal. Calcd. for C13H12O8P2Pb: C, 31.14; H, 2.41%. Found: C, 31.27; H, 2.45%.)
